intro: Trifolium subterraneum var. typicum, commonly known as the common clover, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets arranged on a central stem. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by pods containing several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed areas. Trifolium subterraneum var. typicum is valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it an important plant in agricultural and ecological contexts.
